protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
To be eligible, participants must:

1. Be 18 years or older
2. Be University of Pennsylvania staff, faculty or trainee who is working in person on campus at a PSOM laboratory
3. Have knowledge of safe practices in and access to a biological safety cabinet
4. Have knowledge and access to pipet and PCR machine

primary.measure: Use of a Voluntary COVID-19 Point of Care (POC) Screening Program
primary.description: How often they use the POC screening program

primary.measure: Acceptability of Implementing a Voluntary COVID-19 Point of Care (POC) Screening Program
primary.description: Self-reported acceptability of implementing POC screening program using the Acceptability of Intervention Measure (i.e., "Point of care testing is acceptable to me"). Scale values: 1 (completely disagree) to 5 (completely agree).

primary.measure: Appropriateness of Implementing a Voluntary COVID-19 Point of Care (POC) Screening Program
primary.description: Self-reported appropriateness of implementing POC screening program using the Intervention Appropriateness Measure (i.e., "Point of care testing seems appropriate."). Scale values: 1 (completely disagree) to 5 (completely agree).

primary.measure: Feasibility of Implementing a Voluntary COVID-19 Point of Care (POC) Screening Program
primary.description: Self-reported feasibility of implementing POC screening program using the Feasibility of Intervention Measure (i.e., "Point of care testing seems feasible."). Scale values: 1 (completely disagree) to 5 (completely agree).

secondary.description: Self-report of if participant received any positive test results from saliva-based viral test or Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) approved test
Self report of program usability using the Intervention Usability Scale. Scale values: 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree).
self report of user burden using the User Burden Scale. Scale values: 0 (not at all) to 5 (extremely).
self report of participant's experience in program using open ended qualitative questions
self report of ease of program using open ended qualitative questions
self report of interest in program continuing using a Likert Scale. Scale values: 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree).
self report of interest in program being more widely available using a Likert Scale. Scale values: 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree).

secondary.measure: Participant Perspective of Program Implementation and Change in Behavior or Decision-making Process
secondary.description: self report of perspectives of program implementation and change in behavior or decision-making using qualitative open ended questions
secondary.timeFrame: one time interview after four weeks of intervention
